thread.title: How KOT reacted to rejected Sexual Offences Bill - Nairobi News
thread.title_full: How KOT reacted to rejected Sexual Offences Bill - Nairobi News

title: How KOT reacted to rejected Sexual Offences Bill - Nairobi News
text:
How KOT reacted to rejected Sexual Offences Bill Posted on Feb 15, 2017 10390 Views Busia Woman Representative Florence Mutua who sponsored the Sexual Offences Amendment Bill in Parliament. PHOTO | WACHIRA MWANGI By SYLVANIA AMBANI 
Kenyans on social media have expressed mixed reactions after Members of Parliament voted to reject the Sexual Offences Amendment Bill. 
The Bill, sponsored by Busia Women Rep Florence Mutua, would have criminalized unwanted bodily contact in crowded public places. 
While some Kenyans on Twitter chose to make fun of the bill’s failure by posting memes, others expressed their disappointment. How Team mafisi celebrates after receiving the news that#sexual offences act thrown away pic.twitter.com/L7AFtG7L1f 
— Joseph Omullo (@omullo_joseph) February 15, 2017 
Haha. A female lecturer who happens to be a senior judicial officer told us the sexual offences act is an act based on emotion. Not logic Most Popular Most Commented CITY GIRL: Don’t expose your ignorance, just keep your gun locked away Posted on Feb 10, 2017 
It does not take much to own a gun in this country. All you need is an empty head, an inflated ego... CITY GIRL: Like DP Ruto, own your past before it haunts you Posted on Feb 3, 2017 
They thought they had him when they leaked news that a certain woman has sued the Deputy President for failing to pay...
